thread.title: Baruta wins Senator Ken Maddy Stakes at Santa Anita
thread.title_full: Baruta wins Senator Ken Maddy Stakes at Santa Anita | Boston Herald

author: Associated Press
title: Baruta wins Senator Ken Maddy Stakes at Santa Anita
text:
Baruta wins Senator Ken Maddy Stakes at Santa Anita Associated Press Monday, October 26, 2015 Photo by: The Associated Press In this photo released by Benoit Photo, Baruta and jockey Rafael Bejarano, right, hold off Velvet Mesquite (Kent Desormeaux), left, to win the Grade III, $100,000 Sen. Ken Maddy Stakes, Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015 at Santa Anita Park, Arcadia Calif. (Benoit Photo via AP) Photo by: The Associated Press In this photo released by Benoit Photo, jockey Rafael Bejarano guides Barutua to the winner's circle after their victory in the Grade III, $100,000 Sen. Ken Maddy Stakes, Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015 at Santa Anita Park, Arcadia Calif. (Benoit Photo via AP) prev next comments Tweet ARCADIA, Calif. â€” Baruta won the $100,000 Sen. Ken Maddy Stakes by 1 3/4 lengths Sunday on closing day of Santa Anita's autumn meet.
Ridden by Rafael Bejarano, Brazil-bred Baruta ran 6 1/2 furlongs on the downhill turf course in 1:12.96 and paid $11.60, $6.20 and $4.40 at 9-2 odds.
Velvet Mesquite returned $7.40 and $5.40, while Theatre Star was another half-length back in third and paid $3.80 to show.
The victory, worth $60,000, increased Baruta's career earnings to $313,558, with six wins in 21 starts.
Doug O'Neill won the ninth race to edge Hall of Famer Jerry Hollendorfer 12-11 to win the trainer's title. He had two other winners on the card.
Bejarano earned the jockeys' title 25-15 over second-place Mario Gutierrez.
